body.description: AT2035 Cardioid Condenser Microphone Designed for critical home/project/professional studio applications and live performance, this side-address cardioid studio condenser delivers exceptional detail and low noise. Equipped with a switchable 80 Hz high-pass filter and 10 dB pad, the AT2035 handles high sound pressure levels with ease. Along with its rugged construction and high-performance specifications, the AT2035 provides an exceptional level of consistency from model to model. Large diaphragm for smooth, natural sound and low noise High SPL handling and wide dynamic range provide unmatched versatility Custom shock mount provides superior isolation Switchable 80 Hz high-pass filter and 10 dB pad Cardioid polar pattern reduces pickup of sounds from the sides and rear, improving isolation of desired sound source Includes custom shock mount & protective pouch Includes 20ft XLR Cable & Microphone Boom Arm

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The rugged AT2035 side-address studio condenser microphone delivers exceptional detail and low noise. Equipped with a switchable 80 Hz high-pass filter and 10 dB pad, the AT2035 handles high sound pressure levels with ease. The mic comes with an AT8458 shock mount to attenuate any noise, shock or vibration that’s transmitted through boom. Its analog XLR output connects easily to a digital converter or mixer. Exceptional Detail and Low Noise Perfect Mic for Creators AT2035 Cardioid Condenser Microphone Designed for critical home/project/professional studio applications and live performance, this side-address cardioid studio condenser delivers exceptional detail and low noise. Equipped with a switchable 80 Hz high-pass filter and 10 dB pad, the AT2035 handles high sound pressure levels with ease. Along with its rugged construction and high-performance specifications, the AT2035 provides an exceptional level of consistency from model to model. Large diaphragm for smooth, natural sound and low noise High SPL handling and wide dynamic range provide unmatched versatility Custom shock mount provides superior isolation Switchable 80 Hz high-pass filter and 10 dB pad Cardioid polar pattern reduces pickup of sounds from the sides and rear, improving isolation of desired sound source Includes custom shock mount & protective pouch Includes 20ft XLR Cable & Microphone Boom Arm

Items Included In This Bundle 20ft XLR Cable The XLR Cable is made of high quality connectors protected by a thick ABS inner sleeve. The outer covering is reinforced by state of the art shrink wrap sleeve to resist separation at the termination points. Microphone Boom Arm The adjustable studio boom arm clamps securely to desks, tables and other flat surfaces up to 55 mm (2.2") thick. Offering full 360° rotation and adjustable, spring-stabilized joints, the boom arm repositions quickly for optimal mic placement. Pop Filter The pop filter built with dual layer screen pop filters blocks air blast as normal one layer filter usually does. The gap in between disperses any remaining air pressure. After the sound passes the second screen, the blast is heavily contained to produce great sound recording quality. AT8458 Shock Mount & Bag The AT8458 Microphone Shock Mount effectively attenuates noise, shock, and vibration transmitted through mic stands, booms, and mounts. It's easy to install and adds the total package of unbeatable sound. It is compatible with 3/8"-16 and 5/8"-27 threaded stands.

Specifications Element Fixed-charge back plate, permanently polarized condenser Polar Pattern Cardioid Frequency Response 20-20,000 Hz Low Frequency Roll Off 80 Hz, 12 dB/octave Open Circuit Sensitivity -33 dB (22.4 mV) re 1V at 1 Pa Maximum Input Sound Level 148 dB SPL, 1 kHz at 1% T.H.D.; 158 dB SPL, with 10 dB pad (nominal) Noise 12 dB SPL Dynamic Range 136 dB, 1 kHz at Max SPL Signal-to-Noise Ratio 82 dB, 1 kHz at 1 Pa Phantom Power Requirements 11-52V DC, 3.8 mA typical Switches Flat, roll-off; 10 dB pad (nominal) Output Connector Integral 3-pin XLRM-type

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic microphone, especially for the price I got it for!
reviews.reviewText: I lucked out when I bought this microphone, as it was only $70 and was practically new. And I can honestly say, it was worth every penny, and then some.First things first, as this IS a condenser microphone, you HAVE to give the room you plan to record in proper treatment. Otherwise it WILL pick up a lot of reverb and background noise. I have actually surrounded the microphone itself with studio foam inside of a cardboard box. It's not the prettiest sight, but it was inexpensive and works just as well as the upwards $100 screens they sell for these.Another thing to remember is to buy a proper interface for this. Especially if you are recording on a PC. I suggest using a Line 6 Pod Studio UX1, I managed to find one of those on eBay for about $45. It has an excellent noise gate with it that filters out the background noise in real time, without giving the vocals that robotic sound that noise removal in post tends to leave.Please note, the UX1 does not supply phantom power, so you will need a phantom power supply. I use a Behringer Micro power supply P5400 with it ($20). You will also need to buy at least two XLR cables, one for the power supply, and one to connect to the interface, but you can find some decent ones around $7 -$14, so that is no big deal.As for the sound quality, it is PHENOMENAL. Every syllable comes out clearly, and distinctly. Subtle nuances in tone that some lesser mics tend leave out are crystal clear, and, best of all, it can handle high vocals without peaking as easily like my other microphones did. I managed to go to ear piercingly high pitches, and still managed to keep it from peaking.If you want high quality, professional sound, and don't feel like spending over $300, this is definitely the microphone to get.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great tone for the price!
reviews.reviewText: This mic is replacing an older MXL that I was using. It had a thin sound. This one is much more full and warm. Are there better mics out there? Sure… but, for the money, this one has great tone!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for my money
reviews.reviewText: It sounds clear and has a good enough sound quality for professional recording

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You should consider this microphone.
reviews.reviewText: If you’re looking to capture podcast style audio, this is the microphone that you should be looking at. Of course, when you look at the videos of all the big Podcasters and they’re using the shure microphones, it seems tempting to just get one of those microphones. But take it from a person who’s been in the entertainment industry for over 40 years unless you are a true audiophile, you will not hear the difference. This is a brilliant condenser microphone that if used properly in the proper setting is absolutely brilliant you will not use this microphone to capture audio for a feature film. You will not use this microphone in a concert setting you will use this microphone in online meetings, recording a podcast or any other environment where you need your microphone to pick up your voice and somewhat ignore the rest of the noise in the room. There’s lots of tacky stuff that goes into microphones and you can see some of it in the listing but in the end your question is, does this sound as good as a $600 microphone to 98% of the population it does, and until you can develop an ear that tells you the difference between that and this… just buy this.A couple things you should know. This is not a USB microphone. It uses phantom power the an XLR cable in other words you’ll need an interface that can supply that 48 V power to the microphone you will not be able to plug this in to your laptop and record, you can pick up an interface rather inexpensively.All in all, it may have the price of a mid tier microphone, but its performance is surprising. As I said, in the title, you should consider this microphone, but I will amend it here. You should SERIOUSLY consider this microphone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value, great first condenser
reviews.reviewText: Sound is very natural and accurate to the source. Sounds great on vocals, acoustic guitars and woodwinds. Amazing for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for spoken word. Rivals my re20 in terms of clarity. Definitely needs a pop filter for professional work though. Not too big of a deal since you can get a good one for around 10 bucks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High quality for a good price.
reviews.reviewText: The price is worth it, perfect for a podcast or streaming. It makes the voice sound professional and it gets better if you know how to adjust the gain on it.
LOVE THIS MIC! The sound is clear. I think it's a good one for the beginner. I love it so much. I bought a used one but it still works great!
Produto muito bom, chegou antes do esperado.

Realmente pongo este micrófono por encima de muchos por este rango de precio e inclusive por encima de micrófonos un poco más costosos. Cabe mencionar que he probado los micrófonos: shure pga27, behringer B2 pro, neet worker bee, at 2020, behringer c3, entre otros. Y realmente tené cosas más destacables en cuanto a sonido que estos antes mencionados, hace un excelente trabajo cancelando el ruido de fondo, además su nivel de ruido propio es muy bajo por su precio, a comparación del B2 de behringer que tiene un ruido propio muy alto. Su sonido vocal es excelente, súper neutro, natural y con el cuerpo que le da ese toque "profesional" que no tiene el AT2020, unos agudos súper ricos sin llegar a ser sibilante como el pga27 (qué además suena muy pesado). He hecho pruebas con el de saxofón, guitarra, guitarra amplificada, armónica, voces y su sonido en todos casos me ha convencido, además que tiene un pad de -10 db para fuentes sonoras muy altas y otro low cut lo que se agradece para grabar instrumentos.Realmente lo recomiendo como primera opción sino tiene un presupuesto bastante elevado pero tampoco muy mínimo, tal vez y se ahorre muchas horas buscando el micrófono de entrada ideal para su Home Studio. Yo amé el at2035

Una Joya de Audio-Technica: El AT2035 no es solo otro micrófono de condensador cardioide; es una muestra de lo que Audio-Technica hace mejor: calidad y rendimiento superior. Desde el momento en que lo sacas de la caja, el diseño estético y la construcción sólida te dicen que estás ante algo especial.Sonido de Alta Fidelidad: Lo que realmente distingue al AT2035 es su capacidad para capturar sonidos de forma natural y con bajo ruido, algo esencial tanto para grabaciones de estudio como para actuaciones en vivo. Su gran diafragma juega un papel crucial aquí, asegurando una captura de sonido uniforme y detallada.Versatilidad y Control: Este micrófono maneja altos niveles de presión sonora (SPL) con una facilidad impresionante, lo que significa que puedes grabar una amplia gama de fuentes sonoras sin distorsión. El filtro pasa alto conmutable y el atenuador de 10 dB son detalles que brindan un control fino sobre la grabación, permitiéndote adaptarte a cualquier situación.Aislamiento Superior: El patrón polar cardioide minimiza la captación de ruidos no deseados, enfocándose en la fuente de sonido frente al micrófono. Esto, combinado con el soporte de amortiguación asegura grabaciones limpias y profesionales.Conclusión: El Audio-Technica AT2035 sobresale en todos los aspectos importantes: calidad de sonido, versatilidad, diseño y accesorios. Si buscas un micrófono que eleve tus grabaciones o actuaciones en vivo, este es definitivamente el camino a seguir. Una inversión que vale cada centavo, recomendado sin reservas para cualquier entusiasta del audio que busque excelencia sin compromisos.
Belle qualité audio, encore meilleur que le 2020. J ai pu comparer l AT 2020 et l AT 2035 car je possède les deux, le 2035 est au dessus
